sub_title: Economic Policy Officer at Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate | Asia Enthusiast 🇹🇼🌱
summary:
Economic policy officer | Asia enthusiast | bi-cultural international economist | grit | 

My most expressive character traits are gratitude, zest, perseverance, self-regulation, and curiosity. I hope that by exploring my profile, you will focus not only on what I did but rather why I did it.

I focus on the linkages between Sustainable Economic Development, Industrial Policy, and Globalization in my career in the public sector. Besides, Asian, and especially Chinese Institutions, Culture, and Society are my personal interest. 

Past-time activities: baking vegan sweets | spending time in nature | geopolitics | farmers markets | Outlander | Shiba Inu's | bootcamp | learning about different cultures |

The views expressed here are my own and do not necessarily reflect those of the Dutch Government.

awards.title: European Guanxi Thesis Day Awardee
awards.description: Invited speaker for the European Guanxi Thesis Day on my MSc Thesis.

awards.title: Jane M. Klausman Women in Business Scholarship
awards.description:
Awardee of the merit-based JMK Women in Business Scholarship for 2020. The program helps women pursue undergraduate and master's degrees in business management and overcome gender barriers from the classroom to the boardroom.
See: https://www.zonta.org/Web/Our_Programs/Education/Women_in_Business_Scholarship/Web/Programs/Education/Women_in_Business_Scholarship.aspx?hkey=5fb4f07a-f30d-42ad-bb53-7cb802f1eb7c

awards.title: GUF-100 Award: Student of the Year 2020
awards.description:
Awarded the Student of the Year Award for the Faculty of Economics and Business out of 6700 students. Prize money worth 2500 EUR for research and educational purposes.

https://www.rug.nl/alumni/support-research-and-education/groninger-university-fund/guf-prijzen-en-penningen/guf-100-prijzen-2020

awards.title: Best Summer School Atelier Petrus Camper Festival 2020
awards.description: Our summer school Diversity, Inclusion, and Encounter won the award for best summer school atelier for the 2020 Petrus Camper Festival as organized by the Honours College Groningen. In our self-built website, we portrayed our research findings of the fieldwork in Vancouver BC in an interactive and engaging manner.

awards.title: Holland Scholarship Grant
awards.description: To financially support my study abroad at the National Taiwan University (NTU) in Taipei, I was awarded a scholarship based on GPA, extracurriculars, and motivation from the University of Groningen and the Ministry of Education, Culture, and Science worth 1250 EUR.

projects.title: Summer school Diversity, Inclusion, and Encounter
projects.description: In this group project we investigated public spaces of encounter in Vancouver, as part of the Honours College. Various dimensions of the spatial environment were researched through qualitative methods whilst we also had various lectures by experts and a collaboration with the University of British Columbia (UBC) and Simon Fraser University (SFU).

projects.title: Research Project Cultural Intelligence
projects.description: In this project, we assisted a researcher of the Faculty of Economics and Business by conducting research in the field of Cultural Intelligence. By examining the data gathered from surveys we investigated whether having higher levels of Cultural Intelligence would result in fewer problems faced in Cross-Cultural Teams and if there might be a limit to this. We were rewarded with a 9/10 for our contribution to the research.

projects.description: Providing private English lessons and child care for host families in Hangzhou, China. Furthermore, Chinese Language and Culture lessons were provided by the project and the exchange of Western and Chinese culture within these host families was established.

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description:
➤ Rotation 1: Dutch Authority for Digital Infrastructure (RDI), Innovation and Digital Continuity.

➤ Rotation 2: Economic Advisory Department (AEP), Cluster Macroeconomics and Sustainable Economy, Climate and Energy dossier + labour shortage policy.

➤ Rotation 3: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Dutch Consulate-General Osaka and Embassy Tokyo, Economic Affairs and Trade department, EXPO 2025 and Minister's working visit preparations.

➤ Rotation 4: Netherlands Bureau for Economic Policy Analysis (CPB), Cluster Macroeconomics and International Analysis, Migration dossier and Global Value Chains dossier.

profile_positions.description: 6 months secondment as a project officer on EXPO 2025 preparations and projects related to the EA division (startups and trade mission preparation). Stationed both at the Consulate General in Osaka and at the Embassy in Tokyo.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer EXPO 2025

profile_positions.description:
Delegate for the NAHSS Summer School 2021 on the theme of the "Power of Connectivity". The NAHSS is a national honours programme that aims to let excellent Dutch students experience China by means of a summer programme. It is set up as a public-private initiative. The summer programme includes academic, business, and cultural aspects.

Due to the COVID-19 outbreak, the 2021 program took place in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Delegate

profile_positions.description:
Research on the train network of the Belt Road Initiative (BRI) considering the pillars of sustainability, the economy, and the political environment in an interdisciplinary group of 7 students from different Dutch research universities. 

Responsible for the economic analysis part together with a fellow student.
profile_positions.title: Student Consultant

profile_positions.description: The Young Lady Business Academy is an initiative by Elske Doets, businesswoman of the year 2017. The 5-day academy encourages young women to pursue their dream, getting rid of "picture perfect", and develop themselves personally through various masterclasses by other women role models. Main themes covered include leadership, stepping out of your comfort zone, and networking.

profile_positions.description: Develop insights into whether cultural distances, as measured by the Kogut-Singh Cultural Distance Index, matter when either; facing little difficulties abroad; facing great difficulties abroad; gaining great cultural experience abroad.

profile_positions.description: Demand and supply analysis, theories of comparative and absolute advantage, and tariffs, quotas, and other NTBs.

volunteer_experiences.description:
In this project, a local Taiwanese student and I were coupled together with 2 students from Dahu Junior High School (大湖國中) in Miaoli, Taiwan. During this time, we exchanged both cultures and experiences by means of weekly Skype sessions. We strengthened the bond between foreigners and local Taiwanese children to broaden horizons and learn from each other. At the end of the project, we were invited to go on a trip to visit the school and participate in cultural activities. 

This project was funded and supported by the Ministry of Education of Taiwan. More information can be found here: http://icl.tw/

Year Representative for the 2nd year students of the BSc International Business. By means of this position, we give feedback on the courses in direct contact with the course coordinators and program directors to help them improve the course in the future.

Together with a fellow student, we represented the Honours College from the Faculty of Economics and Business. By means of several presentations we made the freshmen aware of the opportunities Honours College offers and expressed our own experiences with the Honours College.
